text: Bottle from Yamaya. A little old. Soft, chocolaty malt, rich, caramel, some berries, a bit oxidized. Cloudy dark brown, low thick head. Lots of cocoa, berries, light roast. Very well balanced, great chocolate malt but not very sweet. Peppery, bitter finish works well. Body is a bit light, but smooth. Nicely done overall.
Nice porter. Good balance of chocolate and nuts with long aftertaste. Didnt try to do too much

Bottle sample at a tasting at Alexey & Raphaelas place. Thanks Alexey. Black with a frothy tan head. Chocolate, roast, some oxidation, soy sauce, sweet, some dark fruits, medium-bodied, over-carbonated.

Medium to dark brown.
Nice lightly roasted malt caramel and chocolate on the nose and flavor. Smooth and a touch sweet.

33cl Bottle @ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
Dark brown colour with a thick beige head.
Aroma is roasted malt, dark chocolate, red berries, light caramel.
Taste is roasted malt, sweet, toffee, cocoa, nuts.
Medium to full body, average carbonation.
500ml bottle pours a dark brown color with a bit of head. Rich caramel flavor. The caramel is a little too sweet for the alcohol.

Very dark brown, almost bñack with a beige head. Aroma has notes of coffee, some smoke and chocolate. Flavor is slightly bittery, light coffee beans and roasted malts. Light roasty final, coffee notes.

Keg at BD Norwich, 16/02/17.
Light black with a decent khaki cap.
Nose is chocolate, spice, earthy berry fruits, charr, roast malts.
Taste comprises cocoa powder, toffee, light spice, roast malts, dark fruit rinds, dates, raisins, light plummy twang, faint smoke.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, drying close with a light earthy hop linger.
Solid porter.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Pours a very dark brown with a medium, lingering beige head. The aroma contains heavier amounts of chocolate and earthy malts, complimented by coffee and cocoa. The taste has plenty of rich chocolate and coffee, along with licorice, earthy malts, minor roasted malts, and a little bit of raisin. Chocolate aftertaste. Medium in body, with a thin, slick texture, and flat in carbonation. This is a good porter to recommend.
Keg, Brewdog Leicester. Black with a thin head. Rich, strong coffee with earthy smoke. Dark berries with gritty dark chocolate. Some oiliness. Very tasty for its moderate alcohol.
Bottle.Black with little ed,aroma of dark chocolate toffee roasted malt wood cream and coffee,taste is rich and earthy,chocolate coffee dark malt tobacco smoke and blackberry,dry bitter finish.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, chocolate, roasted malts and coffee.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque ruby/black beer with a medium brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts and coffee.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. Not a lot of different flavours; but the flavours that are here, are great. The aroma could have been stronger, but the amazing appearance balances this out overall.

33cl bottle. Clear dark brown pour with a medium height tan head. Notes of roasted malts, roasted coffee beans, dark chocolate, oxidized dark fruit, cherry cores. Medium body and carbonation. A straightforward English porter, excellently executed.
Shared 500ml bottle. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of dark chocolate and roasted malt. Touch of coffee. Similar taste. Acidic finish. A little thin.

330ml bottle
Black color with dark tan head.
Roasted aroma with berry note.
Taste is dark chocolate, bitter roasted coffee and berry fruit.
Great desert beer.

Aroma: rich, chocolatey and malty; a little dry; Appearance: pitch black with fluffy offwhite head that lingers; Taste: follows nose; a classic porter with nice depth; Palate: heavy body with long, malty finish; Overall: a nice porter, but not my favorite style. Would not get again.

Bottle 33cl. poured into a shaker. Opaque dark ruby brown, good two finger frothy tan head, half-way lasting, heavy lacing; roasted malts nose, aroma cocoa, coffee, dark fruits, licorice; smooth taste, medium sweet and bitter, roasted malts, chocolate, coffee; bittersweet aftertaste, chocolate, spicy notes; medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation; very nice velvetty porter.

Pours a thick brownish creamy head and goes away slowly, after a while. Has a very dark brown appearance, close to black. Good lacing. Some aromas of cocoa, toffee and nuts. Dry fruit and spiced hops, and a bit of chocolate as well. Strong chocolate flavours, with notes of caramel and some toffee again. A little bit sweet. Roasted malts bring about hints of coffee. Mouthfeel is fullbodied and has a creamy, warming sensation. Mild bitterness, Medium carbonation. Very good and easy to drink porter. Bitterness and sweetness is well balanced.
LCI from the tap @ DeRat. Nice porter, roasted malt and chocolate with a fresh mouthfeel. Good!

Toasted dark malts, charcoal, dark roast coffee. Black, tiny, creamy, off-white head. Light bitter. More coffee, dark filter, unsweetened, more dark chocolate, cacao, dry, bitter finish, flat carbonation, medium to full bodied. Nice Porter, quite strong on the coffee. Bottle from HonestBrew, Crystal Palace.
Darkish color with a quickly dissipated coffee crema head. A lovely toasted smooth flavor with sweet malts at the forefront. Very enjoyable.

500ml bottle from Liquor King Carlton in Chchch. Darkest brown in color with a large, lasting tan head. The aroma is intense. Roast, charcoal, dark chocolate, blackberry, anise. The flavor is drying and toasty with charcoal notes, 87% cacao, and dark fruit essence. Medium-plus bodied, smooth and creamy yet sharp. Exquisite beer.
500ml bottle. Pours a deep brown with off white head. Strong nose full of chocolate and roasted Malty flavours. The flavour follows the same with a hint of hop flavour near the end.

Black pour with a thin foamy light tan cap. Wonderful earthy and semisweet cocoa on the nose with light roast and light caramel. Full and roasty flavor thats a slight bit of cocoa and light coffee, especially on the finish. Its a slight bit metallic on the finish but has a lovely cocoa and roast body.

500 ml bottle. Pours a ruby reddish black with a creamy, resilient beige head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, roast, red berries. Flavor is chocolate, cream coffee, red berries, burnt toast. Finish is toast, roast, red berry, roasted hazelnut. Medium to full body, velvety and creamy mouthfeel, average carbonation.

500 ml bottle from the Party Source at home. Pours dark brown to black in color with a small beige head. The aroma and flavor have roasted malts, bigger chocolate character, earthy hops, not much that is special, but a solid drinking porter that I wouldnt turn down in the future.
Bottle at ashs. Pours black, nose is dark chocolate, toffee, light funk, taste is sweet toffee, chocolate, bitter, coffee, light smoke.

Bottle shared with Ashton McCobb and Stuu666. Pours black with a thin tan head. Aromas of dark chocolate, tar, faint smoke. Im getting wood, as is everyone else. Chocolate dominates though. Taste is more cocoa, toffee. Like one of those toffee and chocolate bars you get these days. If anything a touch thin, but otherwise very nice.

Bottle thanks to Stuu666.
Appearance - opaque black with a lovely fawn head. 
Nose - gorgeous milk chocolate. Getting wood!
Taste - luscious chocolate and toffee too this time.
Palate - medium bodied with a creamy yet tangy tangy texture and a long dry but elegant finish.
Overall - lovely beer.
Massive chocolate aroma, roasted tempered bitterness. Sweet potentially lactose element. Pleasing rich body. Excellent taste & overall tasty beverage
Black color. Thin , beige head. Full of chocolate and roasted caramel in aroma . Chocolate and hint of vanilla in sweet taste. Lite , roasted bitterness in smooth finish. Very good porter!

Bottle (500 ml). Split 2-ways. Black with a medium fully lasting brown head leaving some lacing. Aroma is of roasted malt, cocoa powder, vanilla, molasses, dried raisins and earthy notes. Taste is fruitier than expected considering the aroma with raisins and dates, sweetness level is moderate to medium, malts are rich, cocoa powder from aroma is now chocolatey and borderline fudgey, theres also vanilla, roasted malts and mild earthy notes. Medium body. Moderate to medium carbonation. Smooth and velvety mouthfeel. Fruity and chocolatey finish. This is a very nice Porter that is smooth, rich and fairly drinkable. I like the combination of fruitiness of chocolate presence. Tasty.

Bottle, shared. Deep brown reddish black pour with tan foam. Aroma is meaty, nice leather, roasty notes, powdery cocoa aromas, very aromatic. Taste is rich, very chocolatey, light roastiness, sweet. Palate is med bodied, good carbonation, perhaps a tad high for the style. Nice porter.

Plum-like, toffee malt aroma with some earthiness and a tiny bit of floral hop aroma. Subdued due to low carb and cold temp. Wish the aroma was stronger as it is very nice.

Pours murky black-brown with tiny fizz and almost no head that fades quick after swirling.

Flavor is restrained chocolate over light wood/earth, light sweetness followed by a touch of roast and a little bit more hop bitterness. All elements that taste fresh and not overpowering as this beer finishes very dry and is light bodied and a little slick on the tongue. No chalkiness or astringency typical of a porter is found here, which is pretty nice. Also no unpleasant roast tartness.

Overall, a great subtle porter. Not a domineering flavorful beer, but one that is VERY well balanced and extremely pleasant to drink with enough interesting malt character to keep from being boring. Very well done as it invites sip after sip.

500ml bottle (William K Kurvi, Helsinki)
Very nice roasty aroma, toasty, a little bit burnt. Soft palate, pleasant carbonation. Super roasty taste. Great balanced toasty porter. Finish slightly drying from both the roast and the bitter hops. So enjoyable, I havent had a beer like this for ages, most people have forgotten how to make a porter this way.

330ml bottle @ William K. Kurvi. Very dark brown color. Tiny size, tan head, struggles to stay. Roasted malts, sweet, malty, caramel, bit of toffee and chocolate in aroma. Dark chocolate, roasted malts, sweet, hints of hops in taste. Long lasting roasted malts and chocolate in aftertaste. Nice balance. I can continue drinking this forever. Beautiful brew. More!

Malty chocolate, some salty licorice on nose. Med bodied, stray malty, easy smooth. Thanks hermod!-- bb
50cl bottle. Pours near black with a thin off white head. Coffee, roastedness, sweetness, tobacco in aroma. Flavor has roastedness, coffee, some cocoa. Creamy, smooth. Pleasant.

(Bottle, 0.5 l - BB 23.03.2016, at William K. Kurvi, 20151014) The beer poured black. Its head was medium sized and lightly brown. Aroma had coffee, burnt malts and dark chocolate. Palate was full bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were burnt malts, cocoa, sweetness, dark chocolate, earth and bitterness. Aftertaste had dark chocolate and bitterness. A tasty brew with strong chocolate notes.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2015 Re-rate. 
500ml bottle from Yamaya. 
L: pours a deep dark brown with a soapy tan head that sticks around for the first half. 
S: theres a displeasing off citrus smell straight out of the bottle, but it clears. Roasted malt, nutty chocolate take over. 
T: the flavour is a nice bitter dark chocolate, a touch of dark fruit. 
F: Theres an upfront fizziness, a flavour wash, medium feel, and then it falls away just a little quickly. 
O: a pretty good Porter with minor flaws.

At the multi-national tasting held in Rome-Italy on 29/08/2015 (Jow, Mortlach, ippopotamo36 and Marco). Bottle courtesy of Sylvan, thank you. Pours coffee bean color, brownish-ivory foam. Nose: dark chocolate, coffee. Mouth: chocolate, milk, round and dry. Great execution of the style.

This porter has a rich and stunning nougat colored foam. A little hard roasted malt is only aroma. Good English licorice has taken over in this porter ale, and a little smoked burnt taste gaining strength after a short time. Hop bitterness is gentle, and it is malt impression know, especially the smoked / burned, the main themes of this porter. A very rich and tasteful porter who has just the balance lies between soft, comfortable and total savagery.

New Zealand came on strong in the late innings of this Rome tasting. Very dark brown pour. aromas of cocoa and coffee ground. Tastes of dark chocolate, cola, licorice, blackberry, coffee, and bitter earth. touch oily palate but overall quite delicious indeed.

A: coffee, chocolate, roasty.
A: black, hazy, minimal head, brown foam
T: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour
P:

À la robe parfaitement noire, ce magnifique porter est présenté dans une bouteille élégante et raffinée. Bien quil ne faut pas se fier à lallure dune bouteille, jaime lorsque celle-ci représente bien le produit quelle contient. À linstar de son contenant, le contenu affiche un caractère noble et élaboré avec soin. Tout se joue en finesse: tant les arômes que la texture, cest satiné, souple, léger, chaud. Dès le nez au bord du verre, jy retrouve des notes complexes de mélasse, de caramel, de chocolat, de vanille mais le tout très délicatement amalgamé. Tiens, je crois que les trois mots qui traduisent le mieux ma pensée en ce moment précis sont: complexité, équilibre et cohérence. Tout se tient dans cette bière: les malts sont juste assez torréfiés sans trop être sucrés; saveurs qui sunissent parfaitement à la légère fraîcheur provenant de quelques jeunes houblons verts. La densité est relativement faible malgré une rondeur agréable et lalcool, et bien celui-ci est complètement dissimulé. Très agréable longueur en bouche qui sestompe très doucement sur des notes délicatement fruitées. À mon avis un Grand Porter!

Bottle from local Yamaya. Deep chocolatey nose, cocoa, roast nuts, and a hint of licorice. Deep dark borwn. Solid dark roast, dark fruit, with some earthiness and wood, and a bit ashy and smoky. Medium-heavy body. Feels stronger than 6%. Well-made stuff, tasty and rich.

Bouteille de 500 ml obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie au coût de 10,15$. La bouteille a complètement explosée à louverture. Jai perdu environ 75% de son contenu. Arôme: Odeur de céréales grillées avec une pointe de noix. Apparence: La couleur est noire opaque. Présence dun énorme col beige mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût céréales grillées avec une pointe de chocolat et de noix. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement chocolaté. (Rating #6338)
500ml bottle. No color description because everything is dark in the night outside. Little head. Roasty, fruity nose. Tasty and intense, with chocolate and much sweetness. Lasting finish.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2015 Pours a dark tan head, definite chocolate and roast malt aromas. Drinks smooth, not as bitter as other porters and is medium in body. Again, lots of chocolate flavours and the finish isn?t super long but has a "fatty" feel at the end. This is most certainly a beer that I could go back to again.

Ruby colour, medium head. Aromas of chocolate, roasted malt, yeast. Flavours of chocolate, roasted malt, bitterness from the roasted malt, hop, hop bitterness. Couleur rubois, moyen col de mousse. Arômes de chocolat, torréfaction, levure. Saveurs de chocolat, torréfaction, amertume de malt torréfié, houblon, amertume de houblon.

Une mousse explosive recouvre un liquide noir opaque. Des arômes de mélasse, de grains grillés, de noix rôties avec des particularités plus ou moins épicées. Un goût acidulé, amer, chocolaté et ce, dune façon toute simple et efficace. Par moment des saveurs lactiques sont perceptibles. Un beau liquide soyeux et velouté qui rend la dégustation des plus appréciable. (1338-051214)

500ml bottle from the Lcbo
wow lots of chocolate in the aroma
chocolate, roasty, 
black, cloudy, frothy, 
medium sweetness, lightly bitter, 
medium body, creamy, average carbonation, 
mmm very good

500ml bottle. Deep brown body, big chocolate head with good retention. Aroma of dark chocolate, dust, herbs, chocolate liquor, mineral water, light coffee, blackberries. Taste is equally satisfying: burned toast, coffee, dark chocolate, blackberry jam, molasses, a touch of smokiness. Very enjoyable.

at 6% abv, this is a real triumph of taste. The pungent bitter chocolate in the nose carries through as the backbone of the taste profile. This is a thick and full bodied porter, with a lactic creaminess combining nicely with a slightly chalky mouth feel. An undercurrent of ripe dark berries and chewy malts with a nicely roasted finish combine with a slight booziness to make this a real treat. Cant believe this isnt an Imperial!

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2015 My Bottom Line:
This aromatic English-style Porter brings together blackberry jam, chocolate and molasses flavors, as roastiness and hop earthiness make the palate pause before a sensuous return of the initial malt-driven forces in the aftertaste.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam covers the darkest brown.
-The malty return (malt flavors and residual sugars) is as sublime as the aroma.
-That fruity fermentation character is wonderful with the chosen grain bill.
-All this in a bottle thats been all the way across the globe! This must be absolutely to die for, fresh, on cask, near the source... Dark Star level quality, Im sure.
-Mouthfeel is smooth and enhances drinkability despite the richness of flavors.

Bottles.

Pours a dark, near black. Thin mocha head.
Aromas of coffee, roasted malts, and dark chocolate. Whets the appetite just inhaling this one.
Tastes are dark chocolate, coffee, cocoa nibs.
Overall, creamy, with the bitterness, of coffee and dark chocolate. This is why craft brewing was invented. A superior brew.

Aroma is rich malts, toffee, caramel and light sulphur notes. Taste is a deep rich malts, caramel, light fig and toffee. Medium/light hop body follows but is fairly well balanced Body is black with a beige head that retains fairly well.
500ml bottle. Black with a frothy tan head. Flavors are coffee, milk chocolate, dark fruits, roasted malts and molasses with nutty notes. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture.

Bottle from the LCBO. Dark brown pour with a small khaki head that is quickly gone. Nose is coffee and bitter chocolate with toasted nuts. Light sweet toffee start with a medium bitter chocolate and coffee middle and a short dry finish. Medium creamy mouth with soft carbonation. Nice porter.

Pours pitch black with a light brown head. The aroma includes rich roasted malt, coffee, espresso, and dark chocolate. Tasting notes include roasted grain, burnt coffee, dark chocolate, and a pleasant bitter finish. The body is full, and the palate is thick with very soft carbonation. This is a wonderful porter! To many attempts at the style have a thin watery body, but this is a wonderfully full and rich porter!

500ml bottle from LCBO, Danforth. 6% Alc./Vol. Pours a dark brown colour with one finger of lasting tanned head. Foamy lacing is clinging to the side of the glass. Aroma of plums, booze and coffee. Taste matches the aroma and has a dry and spicy finish. Moderate carbonation.

Pours a opaque black colour with little head and some lacing. Toasty and chocolate aroma with some darker fruit and some bready notes. A bigger flavour profile than expected. Filled with toasty and chocolate and sort of resinous as well. Quite enjoyable!

500ml bottle from the LCBO in Peterborough, Ontario.  Near black in colour with a thin beige head, little lacing. The aroma is moderately sweet, lots of roasted malts, chocolate, some smoke. The flavour is quite sweet, lots of chocolate, some roast. Finishes long, sweet, small roast bitterness.
Dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit geringer beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr röstmalzig, Schokolade, reife Früchte. Geschmack röstmalzig, bittere Schokolade, Kaffee.

Mondial des bières.
couleur noire, reflets ambrés. Nez café chocolat doux, malt grillé, notes fruits noirs. Gout doux, café caramel, note de bois de barrique, huileuse mais légère en bouche. Bien!

[5625-20130811] 500mL bottle. Mild roasted chocolate and burnt grains aroma. Clear, dark brown black body with a quick foamy tan head. More roasted wood grain flavour sprinkled with sweet chocolate syrup. Full body. Interesting, perhaps a little too burnt. (7/3/8/3/14) 3.5

Intense aroma. Opened it and left it on the table to warm a touch and I was overwhelmed with the roasted, chocolate aroma from a good meter away almost instantly. Pour is pure black with a deep beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, light sourness, biscuit, and over-ripened fruit. Medium to full body. Flavor is marked by dark roasted malts, dark chocolate, tobacco, leather, ripe fruit, a hint of dough, and a spark of fruit and bitter in the finish. Ive had a fair amount of overhyped NZ brews lately but this is anything but overrated. Simply an awesome porter. Ill be grabbing some for the trip home.

Black with just a little brown in the very shallows. Not quite bright, but truly hard to tell. Headless, sad pour even after a good rousing, and still in the glass. Rather velvety, rounded nose full of nuances of milk chocolate leather, spicy, savoury fruit mince, sherry, almond meal and a strange hint of kecap manis. Chalky, dusty mouthfeel. Burnt sugars are predominant lasting long into the finish, but oddly leaning towards the palm sugar kecap manis of the nose. Medium bodied and low in carbonation. There is mocha and roasted cacao, molasses and tar with plenty of bitter sweet dried fruit such as raisin and currents. There is a light buttery note and ate trace of vanillin. Yeast has worked this one well giving it plenty of character. There is even a touch of paperbark (?), nut husks and kopiko candi in there. Great drinking. I can imagine a session of these as easy as just a quiet one. Very pleasing! (50cL, no date stamp, The Liquor Shed, Jandakot)

23/VI/14 - 50cl bottle @ home - BB: II/2015, batch G380 (2014-660) Thanks to Liam for the bottle!
Clear dark brown to black beer, small creamy beige head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: lots of coffee, charcoal, very burned, roasted, caramel. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: very roasted, lots of coffee, dark chocolate, bit sourish. Aftertaste: bit hoppy, very roasted, coffee, charcoal, coffee grit. Not my cup of beer, but nicely done though.

Bottle at Tims place. Thx for sharing todays beers! 
APPEARANCE: pitch black beer, small unstable beige head.
NOSE: mocha, coffee, vanilla, lots of chocolate.
TASTE: mocha, coffee, vanilla, lots of chocolate, nice taste, aftertaste is light and rather long lasting. Dried fruits, berries.
Bottle at Nelson blue nyc: deep black color with foam and lots of malt and some hops. Decent easy drinking porter

from bottle at mondial 2014, mtl. pours very dark Brown with a small light beige head, some retention and lacing. dense bitter chocolate, complex roasted maltiness bill, tobacco, resin, espresso grinds, touch of burnt caramel, hint of sweetness - molasses and perhaps maple. moderate to low carbonation, light body - oily yet never stout-ish, assertive resinous-mineral-bitter coffee finish. solid porter.

Mondial 2014. Oeil: brun presque noir, beau col, début de dentelle. Arômes: tabac, chicorée, noix rôties, grains noirs bien poussés, caramel, café. Saveurs: café, choco, feuilles, notes bien rôties, costaud, élégant. Impresion en bouche: belle tenue, huileux, aucunement écrasant. Arrière-goût: amer, torréfaction, houblons, fruits noirs. Conclusion: savoureux, facile à boire, vivement une ou deux bouteilles pour confirmer mon enthousiasme.

Drank from bottle at the Mondial de la Bière 2014 in Montreal. Very dark brown, thin head. Aroma of brewed coffee and raw, slightly sweet barley. Taste similar, just more fruity, slightly acid. Robust and delicious!

Pours a dark brown with a red hue and is topped by a small rim that doesnt leave much traces. Nose is of roasted malt, nuts and light coffee. Taste is of chocolate, nuts again and coffee. Body was medium to full and mouthfeel really smooth. Carbonation was on the lower side which I can appreciate. Really, really good if you ask me!

Bottle at Taps Beer Bar, Kuala Lumpur. Poured a deep mahogany with a thin broken off white head. The aroma is roasted malt, molasses, light hop. The flavour is mediun to strong bitter with a smooth rich marmite molasses, roast, chocolate,coffee, light spice palate. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation. Need to get down to NZ if this is what they are brewing!

Lovely soft and rich beer, that is sadly scorned in this country because porter is not fashionable. I too am guilty of not drinking this beer often, and every time I do think why is the time between sups so long.

Pour is dark brown with a lot of soapy head. Chocolate is heavy on the nose along with roasted malt. Toffee and grassy hops are in the background. Also smells earthy. The taste mirrors the aroma with bitter roast and tart, grassy hops. Earthy taste as well. Palate is thin and oily, medium bodied with fizzy carbonation. Not too light. A good solid porter with a great roasted taste. Only thing lacking is that thin mouthfeel. Wish it had more substance to it.

100th Porter Rating, I didnt have a great bookend for this milestone & finding one was pretty well not worth the effort, so I opted for a Porter that I had on hand & had been wanting to try for a good long while now. 
Pours basically black with an absolutely gigantic fluffy khaki head that leaves good lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is really very rich, plenty of chocolate, pipe tobacco, & dark fruit all around. Its pungent & has some lightly hoppy, but is really just a big rich elegantly bouquet beer. 

The flavor follows the aroma in a similar, elegant, & well nuanced fashion. Its really nicely bitter, mostly in a roasty/coffe like way but thats not without a noticeable sharp & lightly fruity hop character and subsequent bitterness. The beer has some rich molasses & cavendish tobacco notes, its got a great dark chocolate character as well. The sweetness level is moderately low but the way sweetness is used for balance in this beer is excellent. As it warms more espresso & dark fruit emerge. This hits all the right porter notes for me then does a little overtime... goodness.

The mouthfeel is velvety at first but there is a lingering sharpness. Feels as hie on the tongue as any mouth coating Imperial Stout ever could. 
Fantastic beer that exceeded all my expectations, Im happy to mark it as my 100th Porter rating.

Bottle to shaker
Lots of caramel and sweet roasted malts, molasses, chocolate and a touch of vanilla. Dark reddish brown with a long lasting frothy tan head. Taste is milk chocolate, bitter coffee, menthol, and malt, but very little sweetness.

Bottle - Very Dark Brown in colour, Ruby Red against light. Thick rocky head; good carbonation. Very Malty; lots of dark chocolate, roast coffee, roasty malts, caramel, smoke, hint of liquorice. Fruity; dried fruits, possibly berry fruits. Hoppy; some hop bitterness. Good malt/fruit/hop balance. Very dark chocolate sweet roast malty throughout with a balancing sour hop/fruit edge. Very Good!

Keg at Earl of Essex, Islington, London. A dark brown/black coloured pour with a medium beige head on top. Roasty, malty, bitter chocolate aroma. Tastes similar, roasty, malty, bitter chocolate, hint of coffee, slightly bitter. A really enjoyable rich tasting porter from New Zealand.

500 ml bottle. Deep dark slightly hued brown, lasting mocha foam. Milk chocolatey roasty aroma. Medium dark roast, bittersweet chocolate taste, some dark fruitiness, a hint of coffee. Soft carbonation, medium body, moderately hopped. Smooth and full flavored, delicious. NFL (Not For Lagerboys)
Bottle. Pours a black colour with a thin beige head, malt roast and chocolate aroma, with a dry bitter taste, sweet roast malt finish.

Sampled at Craft Beer Rising 2014 - Brick Lane, London. Keg. Pours dark brown with a thick, tan froth for a head. The character is defined by heavily roasted malts, with ancillary notes of baking cocoa and ash. Medium bodied with fine carbonation and creamy texture. Rich dark malt finish with lasting char, burnt bread and bittersweet chocolate. Ballsy and rich.
smells of light coffee and roastyness pour liquid black with almost no head flavour is a nice mild roasty coffee so delicious and fresh

Draft. A choco-coffee-roast malty brown porter with noticeable astringency and huskiness. Medium-light body, sweet with relatively low bitterness. Creamy carbonation gives it good frothy but the malt is char-heavy like black patent / burnt corn kernels / stale cigarette ash. Pretty one-dimensional.

500ml bottle. No date; less then year old. Served cellar temp.. Guinness glass. HUGE, thick, creamy tan head that lasted for over 5mins.. Maybe 10mins!?!? Thick lacing. Very surprising.. Somewhat focused aromas of dusty, bitter dark chocolate and roasted malt, is overshadowed by intense flavors of dark cocoa powder and coffee, intermingled with dark fruit and heavily toasted malt on the palate. Rich ruby black with half inch of rich brown head.  Aroma is deep roasty chocolate with espresso, date.  Lots going on there.  Taste is big, bold, bitter. A diminutive off-white cap reigns above the close to blackness. Whew, thats an aromatic one with plenty of intricacies. Its dominant feature is probably that of a quality dark chocolate, albeit perhaps a bit fudgey and dense in nature, with plenty of substance, evolving as it warms up toward anise and raisin subterfuges. Bold, chewy and earthy, it showcases abundant esters and bready yeast character, marking one think of blueberry and chocolate muffins. Thick texture with tiny yet abundant bubbles managing to cleanse the palate up and remove the mollasses-like sweetness impression with the help of an above average acidity level from the roast and efficient leafy hops in the background. Impressive ale, certainly far more intense than anything Ive had in the UK, but focused, well-extracted flavours with intensity and texture yet neglectable alcohol presence. I really need to get to NZ...
Bottle.  Chocolate malt and herbal aroma.  Dark brown with giant head.  Burnt wood, dark chocolate, and lightly bitter herbal hops flavor.    Very nice.

Gusher! Probably not helped by the fact it was rolling around in my trunk an hour before I opened it...  Even after settling down, the peaked head lasts a ridiculously long time. Bitter chocolate and oily, roasted malt.

500ml bottle, big gushing at the crack of the bottle, pitch black color, with a big fluffy, leaving bubbly tan head, with a yeasty, burnt dark dried fruit, dark chocolate, mild black coffee, burnt chocolate cake nose, with some chocolate, black, roasted, toasted malty accents, and with some fruitcake, brownie, faint cocoa powder notes in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a yeasty, burnt dark dried fruit, dark chocolate, mocha, black coffee, burnt toast, burnt brownie character, with some good roasted, chocolate, black, toasted maltiness flavours, leading towards a yeasty, dark dried fruit, chocolate, good roasty bitterness finish.
@scratch. Burned toffee nose. Dark chocolate with a nice slight bitter after taste.

Delicious, a lot of subtle chocolate and coffee going on, and very smooth and full-bodied. best porter of three by a long way of that night, thats for sure.

Overall, this is an ideal porter. This is my first beer from NZ, but certainly not my last!

Bottle from brewdog Manchester. Really tasty, thick and loads of coffee. Just a bit too fizzy for me.
I have been a bit disappointed with renaissance lately but this is stunning. A really good and solid beer, great balance and rich deep flavour.

Poured from a 22 ounce bomber. Pours a dark, thick black with a hefty head of beige foam. Great retention. Aroma is nice cacao nibs, dark chocolate, and some cinnamon. Taste is same as the aroma, but the cinnamon really comes through. Finish is a little dry and definitely roasty. Overall its a pretty nice Porter.

Pours black with a large, tan head.
Nose shows dark chocolate, peppery hops, roasted coffee beans and roasted malt.
Equally roasty flavours, focussing of coffee and roasted malt rather than chocolate though. Very smooth stuff, but becomes a little more bold in the dry finish.
Could use a richer body.
not normally a fan of porters but this one is great, nice bittering, and mouth feel/body.
1L growler, pours black with a big mocha head and a wonderful creamy coffee aroma. Sweet espresso taste as well as anaseed but it is amazingly well balanced. Great porter.

Bottle. Poured a black color with an average frothy light brown head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate toasted malt and chocolate aroma. Medium body with a smooth slick texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy toasted chocolate sweet flavor with a medium bittersweet finish of moderate duration. Solid complex brew.

In short: A nice tasty roasted porter with grassy peppery hops.  Very good.
How: Bottle 500ml.  consumed relatively fresh a few weeks after purchase (after a boat ride from New-Zealand).  Bottle sent to me by blankboy, thanks a lot Paul 
The look: Black body topped by a medium tan-beige head
In long: Nose is roasted, light notes of coffee and has a strong showing of peppery hops. Taste has some burnt caramel, chocolaty malts, some raisins, light notes of espresso.  Carbonation is a bit aggressive.  By itself the grassy peppery hops didnt seem so dominant, but when sipping back and forth between this beer and my girlfriends Fullers London Porter (her fetish porter) then the peppery character of the Renaissance Elemental Porter seemed totally disproportionate.  Rather dry (again compared to the Fullers London Porter) and quite tasty for the style. Lacks the smoothness and class of a classic like Fullers London Porter but makes up for it with more Omph!.  A very nice beer, and I feel bad for all of you who are out on dates tonight and arent sitting at home drinking a nice Elemental Porter all by yourself in front of a computer like I am.
Dark brown pour, almost black, off white, creamy head..chocolate, and a little something else...kind of a toffee flavor..overall very drinkable.  Decent porter.

From bottle. Bit of a gusher but slighty out if date so forgiven. Black with tan massive tan head. Aroma has deep dark chocolate, ovaltine, dark fruits and slightly metallic. Taste has less metal, lots of chocolate again, some ovaltine, lingering chocolate. High carbonation, very fizzy. Decent

Bottle. 1 month past its sell by date. Shouldnt matter. Surely. Pours black with a rampant tan head. Far too carbonated took about 10mins to pour. Made for an incredibly foamy mounthfeel. Flavour was very good lots of chocolate, ovaltine and a light coffee hint. Pretty nice. I wonder if a younger bottle would have been better?
Pours dark brown/black with a big yellow porter head. Moderate caramel, coffee notes. Medium sweetness & medium body, lively carbonation with a lovely, short finish. A very drinkable porter.

500 ml bottle. From New Zealand. Massive thanks to Mikko R.
Dark reddish brown colour with average to big fluffy tan head.
Chocolate, vanilla, roasted malt, notes of coffee, grassy and fruity hops and some caramel sweetness in balanced and delicious aroma. Flavour is roasted malt, chocolate, fruity hops, salty liquorice, caramel and hints of coffee. This is pretty excellent. Balanced, complex enough and very tasty. Hits the spot for me. More beers like this please.
Tasted on tap @ The Great Kiwi Beer Festival 2012 in Christchurch. Caramel and chocolate taste. Really enjoyable palate, with a small dryness.

50cl bottle.  Pours a clear dark brown body with a rather lively frothy light brown head that had pretty long retention.  The nose is dominated by chocolate with some lesser notes of roast and dark fruits.  Theres a touch of a sour note going on here too which worries me a bit.  The flavor leads me to believe that theres a touch of infection setting in here.  The flavor is slightly sour and theres way more carbonation than there should be for the style.  The body is a little thin also.  The hoppiness that is in here doesnt really work all that well for the style for me either.  Depressing, as this is the second fancy New Zealand Porter I bought for what I thought was an excessively high price that turned out to be off.  Its not all horrible, but its far and away from what I was expecting.  Certainly turns me off from trying any of the other beers from over there.

Bottle at BrewDog. Massive gushing pour, about 4in of foam! Nose is good though, massive funky liquorice, slightly vegetal, milk chocolate. Chocolate front, crazy fizzy, nice roast malts, hot chocolate powder, liquorice, slight roasty ashy finish. Nice beer, massively over-carbonated :(

Very dark brown color with a towering head, like an over-carbonated Saison.  Aroma of dry chocolate with some dried fruit.  Dry, chalky mouthfeel.  Light chocolate flavor.  Some earthy/spicy hops.  Way, way over-carbonated, like violent Champagne.  I have no idea how long this bottle was sitting on the shelf where I got it, so I would be happy to give this another go some day.  The effervescence really wrecked it.
Absolutely terrific porter. Black with record lasting head. The pleasant roast yields to a rich roasted flavour that seems to get better with each sip.  Full mouthfeel, bittersweet chocolate

Nice dark pour with a creme colored 1/2" head.  Very little aroma.  Bubbly on the tongue with a very subtle chocolate flavor.  Pairs well with spicy food.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

28/06/2011 Brasserie 4:20 (500ml bottle). Nera, intensa, con riflessi bruni, buona schiuma bianco sporca abbastanza persistente. Aroma intensissimo di malti tostati e luppolo, meravigliosamente ben bilanciati tra loro. In bocca ha un esordio dolciastro, in cui si riconoscono note di malti tostati, cioccolato e caffè, e un ben finale amaro intenso ma assolutamente non invadente. Copro medio, carbonazione corretta. Una delle migliori porter mai assaggiate finora.
Dark brown pour, cream colored head. Cocoa, toffee, light metallic notes, some ash. Flavor is a bit hoppy, roasty, chocolate, light hops.
Bottle. Dark brown/red with beige head. Aroma is roasted malts and chocolate. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, liquorice, coffee, caramel, little sweet, hops and a little bitter.
Clear dark reddish brown with a huge light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate and coffee. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and roasted moderate bitter finish. 090212
Bottle from Ølbutikken. Huge head with excellent duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are coffee, chocolate, licorice, roast malt and hops. Nice dry and smooth.

0.5 l bottle bought from GBBF 2011. Almost black dark brown color, lots of foam. Aromas of chocolate and licorice. Smooth roasty flavor with licorice, charcoal and chocolate. Smooth palate. Lots of licorice, good porter.

Bottle. Pours dark brown black with a big tan foamy head that slowly fades to a creamy film and lacing all around. Aroma is dark roasted chocolate malt and raisins. Taste is bitter bakers chocolate and roasted burnt malt with dark fruit and nuts. Palate is full and creamy with a smooth dry finish. Very solid porter with just a slight metallic vegetable taste in the finish.

Bottle in Rome during Mes stag do.  Blak beer lasting tan head.  Bit of choc but again it is oxidised.  Not travelled well. Good choc flavour though.  Again should be good.  3 for the good choc falvour.

(bottle) Poured very dark brown but clear, similar to black coffee. The head however was ridiculous - even with very careful pouring I had to use two pint glasses. Aroma is burnt caramel with some raisins. Full bodied but overly fizzy. The flavour has a nice start with roast malt and bitter chocolate but these harsher burnt bitter tastes develop too much giving a harsh finish of burnt caramel / black treacle. Possibly I started drinking this at too cold a temperature, as when it warmed up the flavour was a bit sweeter and less harsh. Overall this beer doesnt work for me: too much in the way of harsh burnt flavours and over carbonated.

Date: October 28, 2011
Mode: Bottle
Source: Appachelian Vinters, Asheville
Appearance: opaque dark brown, bit tan head
Aroma: dry and earthy chocolate aroma, just a hint of roasted
Flavor: rich chocolate flavor, dry and roasty, earthy
Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 12/20
Rating: 3.1/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: ** /4

Bottle at BrewDog Camden. It pours very dark brown, with a big light tan head. The nose is roasted malt, caramel, chocolate and a touch of smoke. The taste is roasted malt, chocolate, wood, liquorice, caramel, cola, burnt malt and alcohol warmth, with a bitter-sweet finish. Med body, fine carbonation and good balance. Very well done.

A nice gift from SJ. 

Black pour with a nut and vanilla aroma. A nice medium mouthfeel with hints of caramel malts, chocolate, nuts and a sweet finish. Good!

Pours a warm, opaque sable with a VERY thick and fine-bubbled tan head. Not only is this head quite persistent, it forms an "island" in the middle of the mug as it dissipates. Smoky aroma has coffee, caramel and chocolate notes. Rich flavor has firm tones of coffee, caramel and chocolate plus a hint of licorice. Smooth, firm-bodied texture has a fair amount of fizz and leaves a smoky, tingly finish with a mocha tone to it.
pitch black color. Burnt raisins, dark chocolate and dark fruit in the nose. Very intense. Med mouth intense. Great balance with moderate bitter finish.

aroma of red wine, chocolate covered cherries, and very light cream. flavor has wine, sugar, raisin and date, with malt, chocolate, and honey. medium palate, and exceptionally complex. an excellent porter.

500mL bottle.  Poured medium brown with most of the glass full of beige head.  The aroma picked up metallic notes over dry-roasted darker chocolates, roasty black patent, and smoky malts.. the sourness and huge head got me worried.  The flavor found the same unfortunate sourness the whole way through.. burnt black patent and smoked malts at the core.. tacky, sour, and very roasty on the finish.  Medium-bodied with way too much carbonation on the palate.. the sourness actually worked OK in there, but I didnt get what I expected/hoped for from the brew.

(500ml bottle thanks to bu11zeye) rich ruby brown w9ith deep tan head. Nose of cocoa powder, a bit of cream, and vanilla, smells delicious. Taste of medium dark chocolate, a bit bitter, and cracker. Smelled great, finished grainy and bitter.
Bottle. Pitch black pour, extremely thick tan head. Aroma is roasty, burnt malts, licorice and coffee. Flavor is bitter very dry, chocolate and licorice.
A solid and strong porter with an exceptional aroma. Youll be hard pressed to find a better one in NZ with equal strength.

bottle at cropredy ... deep black .. huge tan foam head ... soft meaty dark toffee chocolate roast ... quite bitter ... lots of dark fruits ... plums and green rasisn ... hint of brett ... dark malts ... very nice but hint of brett drops it a couple of points
Dark, malty, rich and with a hint of hops. Tasty beer but low head retention for a dark beer.

Bottle at Cropredy Festival, Thursday 11th August 2011 Craig brought this beer along and shared it, cheers Craig.   Pours chestnut brown with a beige head. Soft in the mouth with plenty of toffee and cappucinno, also quite hoppy throughout.  A7 A4 T7 P4 Ov15  3.7

Bottle from GBBF 2011. Drank at home. Black pour with a tan head. Vanilla, coffee and a little smoke aroma. Rum raisin, coffee and chocolate malt flavour. Classic porter taste. Dry, sweet finish. Very nice indeed.

Bottle. Aroma is molasses, tobacco, chocolate and roasted malt.
Flavour is slight sour, loads of roast, spices and a big bunch of malt. Nice.
Bottle at GBBF. Very dark brown, almost black, big rocky head. Espresso nose, hints of sweetness. Sweet caramel, hints of roast. A bit on the sweet side.

Bottle Pitch black ale with a mid-sized, fluffy, cappuccino head that refuses to dissipate. The nose is overflowing with toasted nuts and creamy mocha. Medium to full-bodied with a milky mouthfeel and fizzy carbonation. The flavor furnishes gobs of chocolate intermingled with caramel and pecans. Crisp, sweet, chocolaty finish. Bottle courtesy of Plovmand!

Dark brown with a large foamy head. Aromas of wood, chocolate, sweet prunes and roasted malt. Taste is similar with lot of roasted malt and hops. Medium creamy texture and fairly carbonated. Lengthy hop finish on this great Porter.
Bottle. Pours black. Tan head. Nose/taste of chocolate, mild hops, candy licorice and roast black malt. Slightly bitter chocolate finish. Medium body.

Big brown head rises out of the glass.  Deep dark red body with
strong carbonation.  Earthy roasty lacquer and wood aroma with
spicy chocolatey notes. Dry-sweet roasty spicy chocolatey taste
with wooden lacquer and earth notes. Mid-to-full body. Mild
mouthfeel. Leaves sticky sugars on lips. Dry spicy earthy
mineraly aftertaste with roasty wooden notes. Quite nice, but
perhaps a bit sweet. (0.5l bottle, Ølbutikken, Copenhagen.)

Sampled at an ESBLS tasting.  Lots of red in this dark brown beer.  The nose is coffee and chocolate.  Interesting flavor is of chocolate colored raisins and is quite nice.  Some roasted flavors.  This is good.

Malty and fruit in the aroma, while the appearance is very dark amber.  The flavor is of coffee and a hint of fruit, with a dry finish.  A very good porter, the flavor doesnt have anything off about it.

Bottle from Star Grocery, Berkeley. Pours black with a thick tan head and a strong coffee aroma. There is a delicious roasted chocolate and coffee flavor with a mildly bitter finish. A very nice brew.

in bottiglia @ Brasserie 4:20, Roma. Wow! Una delle migliori porter mai bevute! Una delle poche birre neozelandesi che fanno un uso corretto di luppoli neozelandesi (sembra un controsenso, ma non lo è affatto). Grandioso sapore tostato e speziato con note di cioccolata. BIS!

Bolttle from Wine & Cheese in Clayton, MO. Pours dark brown with a cafe au lait head. Aroma of darkish milk chocolate. Theres a lot of chocolate, and maybe a light touch of coffee or could be hop. But theres no stopping the chocolate. Excellent.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown color with a small off-white head. Has a roasted malty caramel aroma with hints of chocolate. Roasted malty chocolate and caramel flavor. Has a roasted malty caramel finish.

From a 500ml bottle on 23/4/2011. Pours very dark brown to black with little head. Has a huge chocolatey aroma with some dark fruit. The flavour is a nice balance of roasted malt and sweet milk chocolate. There is quite a strong burnt bitter taste at the end. The body is medium. This is an excellent porter.

(500ml bottle)  Pours a deep mahogany body with a small tan head.  Aroma of roasted malt, grapefruit, peat, and chocolate.  Flavor of roasted malt, subtle anise, chocolate, light pine, and earthiness with a dry finish.

Bottle from Phaleslu. Thanks again Peter. Pours black with a creamy tan head. Aroma of toasted grains, stone fruits, chocolate covered raisins. There is something in the aroma Im having a hard time placing, I want to say it smells kind of like a sharpie but that sounds negative and I am enjoying it. Maybe its just husky grain. Taste is well balanced, lots of malty sweetness, dark fruit, nut, medium bitter finish. Medium body, soft carbonation.
bottle, thanks to bu11zeye, muddy brown color with tan foam, aroma is oak and coffee, flavor of sour dark fruit and coffee

50cl bottle.  Small beige head atop cola black body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, milk chocolate, roast, some cherry.  Taste is moderately sweet, bittersweet chocolate, some raisin/cherry, grape/grapefruit, roast.  Medium body, fairly smooth.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2011 Bottle shared by plovmand, thanks buddy :) 
Pours a dark brown with a tan head. 
It has a pleasant aroma of chocolate, caramel, dark fruit and a hint of grass and coffee. 
Flavour is caramel, roasted malt, liquorice, coffee, tobacco and a hint of hops, 
Finishes fresh and very pleasant, the Halls feeling ;)

Bottle shared with Anker. The beer pours dark brown with a creamy thick tan head. The aroma is dark fruit, chocolate, berries, earthy hops and light roast. The flavour is tobacco, roasted malt, caramel, dark fruit and liquorice and ends up caramelish and liquorice.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2012 Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours a dark brown with a full and fluffy dark tanned head. Lots of roasted characteristics on the nose. Smooth chocolate, dark fruits in the flavour. Taste is dominated by a smooth, mild coffee. Excellent porter

bottle from ølbutikken
dark brown, large smooth light brown head
very nice roasted stuff aroma, also brown sugar, coffee. There is some hoppy balance but it is not very strong and quite hidden, makes the brew appear a little drier.in the aroma.
flavor is roasted malts, flowery and dry hoppy balance, brown sugar, caramel, coffee. aftertaste is roasted malts , sweet caramelly malts, and a little dry hops.
This is a very nice porter indeed.
Pleasant roastiness intertwined with big hop bitterness. Dark fruit, chocolate, mild coffee dominate taste.

Bottle. Creamy excellent lightbrown fully lasting head. Black colour. Heavy malty and moderate hoppy aroma. Nice. Moderate bitter nice flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Some roasted notes. Creamy palate. Nice porter.

De botella en casa. Deep dark brown/black colour with a big light brown head, fairly well lasting leaving a good lacing. Pleasant aroma of well roasted malt, chocolate and coffee too. Good mouthfeel. The flavour is very pleasant: roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, some dark fruit, touch soya (non salty). Moderate bitterness.
Bottle. Low fluffy white lasting head. Clear dark brown body. Mild sweet choccolate roasted malt aroma and flavor with low carbonation and a long aftertaste.

Bottled. black coloured. Dense rown head. Aroma of light roast, sweetness, chocolate, vague liqourice. flavour full of roast, spice, chocolate, light coffee and some herbs. Medium to full bodied. Has a sweetish roasty bitterness in the end.

Bottle @ OznNZ tasting 2011. Bought @ Ølbutikken.
Deep clear chestnut with a smedium, creamy, beige head. Good lacings. Aroma is sweet, milky chocolate, light roasted, some sugar. Medium carbonation, fine creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is mild astringent, ashy and dry with some liqourice, mild smoke, lots of chocolate. Lingering malty bitter finish. Very lovely.

A Sim rate (one of the epic "Pool Table Tastings" in Rome, thanks to Alex): Rich, full and chocolatey aroma. Flavour thats woody with dark fruit and a slight smokiness mixed with chocolate. Very nice.

500ml bottle. Pours thick and rich black in colour with a nice creamy head of coffee coloured foam. Dark chocolate and cocoa in the aroma with the same in the flavour with some burnt toffee flavours mixed in. Robust and hearty with a long dry finish.

Bottle 500ml. @ [ The Pool Tabel Tasting in Rome ].Clear medium to dark brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, dark chocolate, smoke - peat, light sweet licorice. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20101219]
Bottle at MikkellerBAR. Black - light brown head. High malty. Nice smokey. Ok hoppy. Fruity. Light licorice. Ok bitterness. Cocoa. Chocolate. Smooth.

Good dark brown in colour. Great malt profile with hints of English yeast esters there as well. A bit of grassiness from the hops with good malt and slight roastiness as well. Every beer Ive has from this brewery is very impressive.
Dark brown to black colour with a very thick biege head. Oaky aroma, chocolate and coffee. Taste is quite light and warming. Very nice.

Another fantastic brew from Renaissance Brewing, with all the beers I have tried from them proving beautifully drinkable and enjoyable.

Poured from bottle into a stem glass, it was nicely black in colour with a very big tan-coloured head, which holds very well and leaves plenty of lacing. Big aroma of roasted malt and dark fruits. Very balanced, classic porter tast, with a long finish. An excellent example of the porter style, almost too easy to drink.

Espresso black with a persistent tan head. Aromas of roasted malt, chocolate, vegemite, and burnt toffee. Flavour is rich and full, lots of dark chocolate/espresso backed up by a firm, roasty bitterness. Some raisiny port-like notes add depth and complexity. Really solid beer, would drink often if it wasnt so expensive.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2011 Bottle. Very dark brown with a lumpy 2 inch head in a large tulip. Aroma is very restrained, but good: a nice balance of chocolate and roasted malt, coffee, dried fruit, grass. Taste is bigger - bittersweet mocha, prunes, a little citrus, floral and grassy hops. Long, slightly woody dry finish. Flavorsome and involving but still light and easy-drinking. [3.9]Black with brown edges, lovely beige head that laces well. Aroma has mingled roast and grassy hops, chocolate, coffee, muscatels. Fills the mouth. Taste is just sweet with fried fruit, then modest roasted malt, coffee and good chocolate. Drying, moderately bitter finish is long. Graceful.

This is one of the most balanced porters I have tasted in Australasia.  I love the New Zealand beers that are finding their way to Melbourne at the moment, and this is one of the best with a toasty, coffee and chocolate nose and a full suptuous palate.  Yum.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2010 500 ml bottle

Aroma: chocolate and hints of tarry burned something, very malty and I think I may have gotten a hint of veges, green  beans? - (20.11.10 Seven months later my guess is that I got a aberrant batch. There is no green vege here now.)

Appearance: dark brown opaque with frothy/foamy brown head that lasts quite awhile. and sticky lacing.

Taste: smooth, a little bitter,  and a touch of sweetness, there may be a hint of metallic aftertaste - not sure. (20.11.10 None at all now)

Palate: very full bodied, creamy and sticky texture, thick
 adequate carbonation, does not overboard, finishes mildly and takes a few minutes to do so.

Overall: This is a good porter. Lets leave it at that. (20.11.10 Still true)

Pours black with a thick tan head. Aromas of caramel & coffee, some fruits (passion or citrus perhaps) underneath. Thick, rich and full bodied, lots of dark malts, chocolate. Firm bitterness and a nice long lasting finish. Delicious, smooth and amazingly easy to drink. I love what the Renaissance team are doing with beer, this is easily one of the best beers made in the ANZ region.

Yes.  This is wonderful.  Caramel notes float over a floral bed, leading you down to a rich deep purple-tinged ale, while the head holds strongly white above.  My first taste was sweet then, boom, round complex flavours hit the tounge to fade to a smooth warm aftertaste.  And the second sip is even better. Amazing stuff.
Lovely - notes of coffee and chocolate... nice toasty bitterness... Quite crisp but a little thin, especially in the mid-end palate.

Bottle 500ml. Unique beer. Aromas are intense: roasted malt, flowers, dark fruit, chocolate, and alcohol. Taste has a sweet start, with bitterness taking over for a long finish. Velvety palate, with a medium-to-full body. Black colour, with a frothy white head.

Bottle. Pours with a large brown head over a ruby-black body. Aroma of passion fruit and blackberries. Tastes of espresso coffee and bitter chocolate finishing with touch of bitterness. Medium to full bodied and smooth. Nice-different to have the blend of both the dark malts and the hop aromas and flavours.

Bottle from Brew on Quay in downtown Auckland.  Pours near black with a big rocky tan head.  Nice aroma of dried fruit, roasted malt, smoke, dark chocolate, nuts, toast, hops, and a dash of whiskey.  The chocolate is stronger in the flavor than on the nose, and the hops come through more here, too.  Smooth and complex, with a medium body and good carbonation.  Dry, smoky finish.  The first beer I ordered in New Zealand turned out to be one of the best.

Thanks for sharing Nate. This was a big juicy porter, lots of chocolate, coffee and oily flinty character. Good bitter finish with a thin to medium body. I would like to try this again just to get more of a feel for it, but otherwise a very good, though not great, beer.

Large tan coloured head dark porter has a red/brown tinge,aroma chocolate good malt rich roasted,caramel vanilla coffee cocoa,flavour dry,roasted,cocoa chocolate,vanilla and caramel,coffee essence taste,smooth bitter,easy light sweetness,liccorice very noticeable,finish dry good biter even tastes nice porter.
Black with red tinge.  Sweet coffee and dark fruit aroma.  Flavour is dark fruit with coffee, caramel and slight roastyness.  Slight bitterness to balance out the finish.

Bottle. Very dark pour, almost completely black, with a large, long lasting tan head and a fair bit of lacing. Aromas of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and dark fruit all stand out. Flavour is pretty similar to the aroma, with a great balance between the sweet and bitter elements, and a slightly stronger presence of the hops. Very smooth and creamy, this is a great porter from Renaissance.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2010 500ml bottle, batch 0078.  Beautiful aromas of strong dark dried fruit (raisin especially), coffee, dark malts, dark chocolate. Very dark brown hue with small creamy beige mostly lasting head and excellent lacing. Flavours of coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt, Christmas pudding fruit.  Smooth rich velvety mouth-feel. Fruity and bitter finish. A fantastic beer, even 500ml wasnt enough!

Black body with light tan head that hung around for a while. A little burnt malts and some liquorice in the aroma. Smooth taste, dont really notice the chocolate it is more coffee to me, medium body, easily drinkable and very moreish.
Last beer of the tasting and hit the spot. Rich and complex on the nose with dark fruit notes. Smooth and rich in the mouth with a complexity that finishes with nice roasted and choc notes. Very nice

Bottle, purchased at the tiny bottleshop in the Invercargill Brewery. Pours near-black with ruby highlights, with a large thick cream coloured head. Velvety mouthfeel, rich chocolate liqueur, plums, and berries. Sweet, but balanced by a soundly bitter finish. Very very nice.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
A balanced, medium bodied porter. Good colour, healthy head, a smooth mid palate, although the roasted characters were slightly stoutish. Has a healthy flavour spectrum and finish.
Will I revisit this beer?
Certainly!

Draught at Creek Pizzeria (opposite the Brewery), Blenheim. Pours almost black with a creamy tanned head. Sweet aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, plums and dark fruit. The flavour is extremely well balanced between the roasted malt, dark fruit and chocolate. Silky smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied and a fantastic lingering bitterness. The benchmark for a quality porter, Im missing this beer already.

Pours black with a thick creamy head which persists. Aroma is of roasted malts and raisins, Yum! Taste is roast coffee, chocolate with hints of toffee and caramel. Lingering bitter chocolate finish leaving you begging for another sip.

Pours black with dark red edging and a tan head. Dark fruit aromas  plum, raisin, cherry  as well as slight malt and caramel characters.  Coffee, dark chocolate and roasted malt flavours all come through strong, with caramel flavours and a cherry and plum sweetness just before the bitter malt finish. Full-bodied and smooth, absolutely lovely.

500mL bottle shared with sdriessen. Pours black, with ruby edges. Aromas of caramel, dark chocolate, spice. Flavour begins quite bitter, strong dark chocolate/coffee notes dominate. Plum like fruit, caramel and roasted malt also come through. Long bitter chocolaty astringent finish. Quality.

500mL bottle, enjoyed with donfardz64 in sunny Nelson, NZ. Strong chocolate, roast malt nose. Some strong whiffs of caramel, dates, cinnamon and spice. 
A dark brown head, black in the glass. 
Rich flavours of brown sugar and malt. Strong coffee that really shows as the beer warms up. Sweet plum and clove flavours. 
A chocolaty, bitter finish with some hops and clove. A wonderful ale!

50 cl Bottle brought from N-Z by a collegue, thanks Gijs! Deep dark brown to black colour, creamy beige head. Lovely sweet aroma with hints of coffee, chocolate and liquorice. Reminded me a lot of Great Divide Yeti. Flavour is sweet at first, chocolate, liquorice, going towards a hoppy and lingering coffee bitter finish. A bit thin mouthfeel, but very good overall. Would have been excellent with a thicker mouthfeel IMO.

Excellent Porter! Poors a almost black beer with a large tanned head. Aroma of burnt malts, caramal and liquorice. A full and creamy mouthful. Complex malts in the mid-palate, chocolate and then a long lingering roasted finish. Very well balanced. Not cheap but worth every cent.

(Bottle 50 cl) Pours a warm dark brown with a tint of red and a creamy light brown head that leaves quite some lacework. Aroma of fruit and burned malts. Quite full-bodied with sweetish roasted malts, overripe fruit, a little ashes and a dry and hoppy finish. Nice one. 190408

roasty, mocha and caramel aroma. A hint of berry too maybe? Black wih a lingering tan head. Initial caramel/toffee flavour with a hint of pear, then rich bittersweet chocolate  with a great blend of roast, chocolate, spicy hops and berries at the end. A wonderful velvet mouthfeel too.
Black colour with a tan head. Roasted, coffee bitter aroma with some sweetness and a light smoke note. Roasted, coffee bitter flavor with fruity notes.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2009 Poured dark brown with substantial tan coloured head. Aromas are inviting! Dark bitter chocolate, dry coffee roast and a hint of dark fruit. Palate translates well, chocolate and dry roast. Finish is dry & bitter from the dark malt and a tad smokey. Good stuff!

Sune (sunevdj) sent this to me from New Zealand claiming that he was told it was the best beer in New Zealand.  He was probally told correctly.  Its pretty darn good.  Dark dark pour with decent head.  Lots of roasted flavors with burnt and roasted malts.  Touches of mocha and some chocolate.  Pretty tasty stuff.

Bottle at Toncatchers event courtesy of Sune. Pours a dark brown color with a medium tan head. The nose had a bit of a vegetable quality--I could not place it, but it was not objectionable. The flavor showed good roasted/burnt malts, some light smoke and coffee. The mouthfeel was flawless, very smooth and creamy. The finish was medium in duration and very dry with a slight astringency. Overall: A winner, I hope to try more from this brewery some day.
Bottle. A black beer with a hint of red, with a brown head. The aroma and taste is of coffee, chocolate and licorice. Medium body with a dry coffee finish.
Dark brown with medium beige head. Sweet aroma with notes of roasted malt, coffee and caramel. Sweet flavor with roasted malt, hops and coffee notes.

Bottled. A very dak brown beer with sediment floating around under a brown head. The aroma is sweet with notes of wood, alcohol, chocolate, whiskey, and prunes. The flavor is sweet with notes of chocolate, prunes, wood, whiskey, and alcohol, leading to a dry woody finish.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2008 Bottle.
Dark brown coloured with a medium sized beige ehad.
Aroma of dried fruits and soy sauce with notes of liquorice and roasted notes.
Sweet and roasted flavour of coffee and liquorice with notes of soy sauce and hops with roasted notes.
Roasted finish.

Blind tasting at Papsoes place, another great session, thanks Henrik! Beer #9: Pours hazy dark brown with a tan head. Light roasted and chocolate malt aroma. Light leathery flavour. Mild liqourice note in addition. Light acidic note from the roasted malt with a smooth chocolate note following. Ends with a bitter and roasted malt flavour into the finish.

# 9 Bottle. [Papsoes great blind tasting, thanks Henrik!]
Average creamy beige head that mostly lasted. Good display of lacework. Black color. Aroma of berries, toasted malt, dried fruit, mild port wine like. Over the palate came dry roasted malty feel. Chocolate and hint of coffee and wood. Underlying hops. Medium bodied with a soft carbonation and dry and light alcoholic texture. Moderated bitter and sweet flavor. Roasted malty and chocolate like finish. 
7-3-7-3-15 = 3.5
19-04-2008

This is my favourite beer style ,what a great 4 pack from this brewery. The bottle poured an inky black with a fluffy tan head, very tight bubbles. The scent of this beer was coffeeish and chocolaty with hints of ripe plums. The creamy rich head was followed by an intense flavour dominated by roasted notes and sweet caramel, finishing with a lovely chocolate sensation. The lingering flavour was still around well after the bottle was gone. This beer is truely a stand out in their range and accordingly this is the brewers favourite style.

Pours a sparkling black with diminishing beige head and a hint of lacings. Smells of toasted malts and oak. Low sweetness with some lingering bitterness. Aromas of toasted malts, dark chocolate and oak. Nice, quite heavy hops profile with slightly piney. Tastes a lik redwine. Soft carbonation. Medium bodied with a slightly sticky mouthfeel. Long dry finish with aromas of hops, and hints of sweet liquirish. This stout can easily messure up with the best American stouts.

Bottle, a lively pour, black with a purple-tinge and a huge pillowy tan head. Beautiful aroma, very fruity (like raisins) and quite hoppy for a porter. A good full mouth of chocolate, some aniseed, and a high hop presense again. The finish brings more roasted malt to the palate and stay with you for a while. Delicious!
Fairly hoppy and tons of body - quite thick and notes of chocolate and burnt tree.  Very solid from a terrific brewer out of Blenheim.  A must-try.

Bottle. A great porter, very true to style, and a refreshing change from many NZ takes on Porter, which often have a very thin burnt character. None of that here. Big aroma, roasty/toasty notes, and a hint of plums maybe. A full rich smooth flavour, with very well integrated malt and hops. Caramel and coffee dominate, and lead into a dry finish with a roasted flavour that really sticks around.
UPDATED: SEP 28, 2008 Fantastic beer, loads of flavour without the sharp taste.  Thoroughly enjoy this beer on a winters day in front of the TV on the couch!!!  Love it!!
A joy to taste. Deep black colour, rich plum like scents with hints of stonefruit. The taste lingers long after the bottle is empty. Worth indulging with a Cuban cigar (apologies American raters).

Dark black in colour with thick creamy toffee coloured head. Tropical fruit and hints of fejoia. Roasted coffee and malts, mild hop bitterness, dry finish.

Nice bottle and one of the better labels in New Zealand.
Batch 0009 tasted 3/1/07. Big dark black, nice tan head. Hint of liquorice & toffee nose. Char/burnt mouth, big full that lasts to the end. Nice beer - not for the uninitiated

Draught at the brewpub.  Near black. Dry and surprisingly crisp, medium bodied. Heavily roasty, anise and licorice dominates. Well hopped, resulting in a mangoish bitter finish. Like the other beers at this new brewpub its well crafted.
